item.title: Report E-2025020245
item.description:
Report E-2025020245

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-18
  • City: VISALIA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 18, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1789 had faulty packaging and released approximately 12-ounces of product to the lid of the drum. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to remediate the site. Crews tightened the loose cap and utilized absorbent pads to wipe down the impacted drum. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon bucket for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025020244
item.description:
Report E-2025020244

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-17
  • City: W SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 17, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN3264 was damaged and released approximately twelve (12) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services. LC who dispatched a crew from Graymar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the trailer interior. GES personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer floor and swept them in with hand tools. GES personnel transferred the product from the damaged 275-gallon tote to a new 275-gallon tote for further shipment by the terminal. One (1) 55-gallon drum containing all spent absorbents, PPE, and cleanup debris, and one (1) 55-gallon drum containing the broken-down damaged 275-gallon tote were staged onsite as waste.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking during sort operations. The box was accidentally dropped (Human error). Inner contents unknown, barrier bag filled with absorbent (vermiculite) and closed with a bag tie by the shipper. EE refused to open the plastic bag. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and held pending disposition from the shipper.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0

  • Description: Shipment was discovered during sort operations on a conveyor belt experiencing an evolution of heat. There were no visible flames only smoke. The laptop was soaked in water and placed in a salvage drum. Inner contents: Dell Laptop (Inspiron 16), MFG YR:2025, AT:4BVMH74, EX:9425374096 *NRC was contacted Incident#

item.title: Report I-2025020013
item.description:
Report I-2025020013

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-29
  • City: SAN FRANCISCO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Customer had moved seat after phone had fallen, which jammed the phone. Smoke began to form around his seat, and he alerted the crew. No fire was observed; however, smoke emitted from the device. The smoke was initially heavy. A halon and water extinguisher cleared some of the heavy smoke. TCB gloves were used to retrieve the device, and it was successfully contained, The device was placed in a Iavatory by 4R for the remainder of the flight Chemical odor Iingered in the cabin long after the event.

item.title: Report E-2025020238
item.description:
Report E-2025020238

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-19T06:18:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-14
  • City: WEST SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 13, 2025, one (1) 1-liter bottle of nitric acid was damaged and released approximately one (1) liter of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services who dispatched a crew from Graymar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. GES crews deployed a neutralizing agent to the impacted area and worked it in with hand tools until a neutral pH reading was confirmed. The damaged bottle and box were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The PPE and neutralizing agent were collected and containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025020233
item.description:
Report E-2025020233

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-19T06:18:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-13
  • City: LONG BEACH
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 13, 2025, two (2) 50-pound bags of sodium hydroxide were torn in transit and released approximately two (2) ounces of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. GES personnel used hand tools to collect all spilled material from the impacted trailer. All collected material, two (2) damaged 50-pound bags of sodium hydroxide, and all PPE were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for future transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025020216
item.description:
Report E-2025020216

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-17T21:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-21
  • City: SAN JOSE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 17:51 PM ET, Ed Ramos with USJ contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in San Jose, CA. The spill consisted of approximately half a gallon of Alphaguard Puma Base Coat, which was released from a 1–5-gallon metal bucket due to other freight puncturing the bucket during transit as the shipper packed it too closely to another pallet, impacting the inside of the trailer. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will clean the spill and place the waste into a 1–35-gallon metal drum.
